natorisatori: @natashanoel001 I did EXACTLY THIS years ago in my early 20s. For months I fought this unexplained urge to cut off all my hair and when I finically did I realized I just wanted to see the beauty beyond the hair, my real face. I also struggled with anxiety and depression at that time... I never regretted doing it as it was one of the most empowering phases of my life! It was also I time that I got deeply in touch with my inner masculine energy, which ultimately gave me a nice balance between feminine and masculine. Most people are closed off to their own inner opposite energy and we need to be in touch with both sides to be balanced and whole. I love it 👏🏼 you rock it! And I get you 💯

peta_white1: When I was watching your video, I was in awe of you. I thought a couple of a things, the first was ‘I can’t believe she is shaving her head’ (said with an admiring smile 😊). The second was ‘wow! How good it must feel to shave away our ego’. Then it made me wonder what I considered to be my ‘biggest strength’ or what ‘added more to my beauty’? What fuelled my ego? I’m still pondering this, I’ve actually been thinking a lot lately about my ego and the masks that I put on for the world. I’m so tired of having to be 𝓉𝒽𝒶𝓉 person, I’m slowly tearing down negative patterns and feeling more comfortable in my own skin. But I know I have a very long way to go before I can 𝓈𝒽𝒶𝓋𝑒 away my masks, feel liberated and free. I know that you have your own personal reasons for doing this and whether you share your journey or not is really your decision in the end. But I am so so glad that you did share it, because I got so much out of watching the process and it looked like you had so much fun and was surrounded by supportive friends and loved ones 🦋❤️🙌🏾😁
